metatags.og:site_name: U.S. Department of Homeland Security Transportation Security Administration
metatags.og:title: TSA expands acceptance of digital IDs to West Virginia | Transportation Security Administration
metatags.og:description: CHARLESTON, W.Va. –The Transportation Security Administration (TSA) is now accepting West Virginia-issued mobile driver licenses (mDLs) at checkpoints with digital ID readers nationwide.Travelers who have downloaded the West Virginia Mobile ID app to their smart phone can use that for identity verification during the screening process in lieu of handing over a physical photo ID and boarding pass to the TSA security officer at the entry to the checkpoints at West Virginia International Yeager Airport and Huntington Tri-State Airport and other airports nationwide.

metatags.og:description:
‎In today's connected world, Mobile ID offers a private, secure, contactless way to verify identity, either at home or on-the-go. Everything is on your phone – now your ID is, too!

Intuitive, easy-to-use and highly convenient, West Virginia Mobile ID can be used anywhere it’s accepted, in any contex…
